title: [K-12] Learner-Centered Foundational Java Programming Course

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental programming concepts and ability to construct simple logic
context.additional_context: Self-directed learning environment using personal devices (tablets/laptops), combining offline mentoring sessions with online self-paced activities

learning_goals: When solving programming problems, learners can independently design their learning pathways with 80% or higher autonomy.
Learners demonstrate self-directed error-correction capabilities at 75% or higher in formative assessments.
Learners complete three or more mini-projects using basic Java syntax (variables, conditionals, loops).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
